text:
A Girl's Struggle

A cramped, messy room; Katerina is anxious.  
Sonia: "Can I really earn enough?"  

Katerina: "It's so hard, my dear."  

Sonia: "I just want to help us."  

---  

A dimly lit corner; books scattered everywhere.  
Sonia: "I wish I had more education."  

Katerina: "We did what we could, Sonia."  

Sonia: "But will it ever be enough?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrator reflects on the struggles of his family, particularly the hardships faced by his daughter Sonia due to poverty and lack of education.
